001package com.technototes.library.hardware.motor;
002
003import com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.DcMotorSimple;
004import com.qualcomm.robotcore.util.Range;
005import com.technototes.library.hardware.HardwareDevice;
006import java.util.function.Supplier;
007
008/**
009 * This is for "continuous rotation" servos. They work, unfortunately, like motors
010 * without encoders: You can set a power (from 0 to 1, typically, with .5 as "stop") and the
011 * servo will spin in the direct, at the provided speed...
012 *
013 * Not Yet Implemented!
014 * TODO: Implement this
015 */
016public class CRServo extends HardwareDevice<com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.CRServo> implements Supplier<Double> {
017
018    private double min = -1, max = 1;
019    protected double power;
020    protected DcMotorSimple.Direction dir;
021
022    private String dirStr() {
023        return dir == DcMotorSimple.Direction.FORWARD ? "Fwd" : "Rev";
024    }
025
026    /**
027     * Create a motor
028     *
029     * @param device The hardware device
030     */
031    public CRServo(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.CRServo device, String nm) {
032        super(device, nm);
033        power = 0;
034        dir = DcMotorSimple.Direction.FORWARD;
035    }
036
037    /**
038     * Create a motor
039     *
040     * @param deviceName The device name
041     */
042    public CRServo(String deviceName) {
043        super(deviceName);
044    }
045
046    @Override
047    public String LogLine() {
048        if (min <= -1.0 && max >= 1.0) {
049            return logData(String.format("%1.2f%s", power, dirStr()));
050        } else {
051            return logData(String.format("%1.2f%s[%1.2f-%1.2f]", power, dirStr(), min, max));
052        }
053    }
054
055    /**
056     * Sets the min &amp; max values for the motor power (still clipped to -1/1)
057     *
058     * @param mi The minimum value
059     * @param ma The maximum value
060     * @return The Motor (for chaining)
061     */
062    public CRServo setLimits(double mi, double ma) {
063        mi = Range.clip(mi, -1, 1);
064        ma = Range.clip(ma, -1, 1);
065        min = Math.min(mi, ma);
066        max = Math.max(mi, ma);
067        setPower(power);
068        return this;
069    }
070
071    /**
072     * Returns the DcMotorSimple.Direction the motor is traveling
073     */
074    public DcMotorSimple.Direction getDirection() {
075        return dir;
076    }
077
078    /**
079     * Set the motor to go *backward*
080     */
081    public CRServo setBackward() {
082        return setDirection(DcMotorSimple.Direction.REVERSE);
083    }
084
085    /**
086     * Set the motor to go *forward*
087     */
088    public CRServo setForward() {
089        return setDirection(DcMotorSimple.Direction.FORWARD);
090    }
091
092    /**
093     * Set the motor to go in a particular direction
094     */
095    public CRServo setDirection(DcMotorSimple.Direction dir) {
096        if (this.dir != dir) {
097            this.dir = dir;
098            com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.CRServo device = getRawDevice();
099            if (device != null) {
100                device.setDirection(dir);
101            }
102        }
103        return this;
104    }
105
106    /**
107     * Gets the power value for the motor
108     *
109     * @return the power value (as a double)
110     */
111    public double getPower() {
112        com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.CRServo device = getRawDevice();
113        if (device != null) {
114            power = device.getPower();
115        }
116        return power;
117    }
118
119    /**
120     * Set the (range-clipped) power of the motor
121     *
122     * @param pow The power value (-1 -> 1)
123     */
124    public void setPower(double pow) {
125        power = Range.clip(pow, min, max);
126        com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.CRServo device = getRawDevice();
127        if (device != null) {
128            device.setPower(power);
129        }
130    }
131
132    /**
133     * Gets the *speed* of the motor when it's used as a DoubleSupplier
134     *
135     * @return The speed of the motor
136     */
137    public Double get() {
138        return getPower();
139    }
140}
